name: pr
description: Create a pull request with proper description
instructions:
Create a pull request following these steps:

1. Analyze current branch:
   - Run `git status` and `git log origin/main..HEAD`
   - Run `git diff origin/main...HEAD` to see all changes

2. Ensure branch is ready:
   - Check if all changes are committed
   - Check if branch is up to date with remote
   - Push to remote if needed

3. Draft PR description:
   ## Summary
   - Bullet points of what changed (WHY, not what)
   - Reference any issues (#123)
   
   ## Changes
   - List major changes by category
   
   ## Testing
   - How to test the changes
   - What test cases were added
   
   ## Screenshots (if UI changes)
   
   ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

4. Create PR:
   ```bash
   gh pr create --title "<title>" --body "<description>"
   ```

5. Return the PR URL

IMPORTANT:
- Make sure commits are pushed first
- Title should be clear and concise
- Description should help reviewers understand context
- Don't create draft PRs unless user specifies
